alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 22 at 9:52PM AKST until December 23 at 11:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 11 PM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches. Northeast winds gusting 35 to 50 mph. Snow and blowing snow reducing visibility to one quarter mile. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...From 9 AM to 11 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds will become southeasterly overnight Saturday and through the day Sunday. This will induce a much wetter snow following blizzard conditions, and a possible transition to rain below the pass and into Valdez.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
